title: Update regarding Quantum Compute
story_body:
Quantum Compute (QNTM) is feeling the heat, and it's not just the stock price that's getting torched. The entire tech sector is getting slammed by industry-wide shortages, and QNTM is right in the crosshairs. 

Let's face it, folks, the chip shortage is real, and it's not just a QNTM problem - it's a sector issue. Every major player is feeling the pinch, from Intel to AMD, and it's anyone's guess when we'll see some relief. 

The bagholders are getting nervous, and rightly so. QNTM's stock price has been on a wild ride, and the latest shortage woes have it looking like it's going to be a long way down from the moon. The question on everyone's mind is, when will the bleeding stop? 

We've seen this movie before, and it doesn't end well for the bulls. The last time we had a shortage of this magnitude, the sector got crushed, and QNTM was no exception. The difference this time around is that the company's got some serious growth prospects, but that's not going to matter if they can't get the parts they need. 

The real question is, what's the play here? Are we looking at a buying opportunity, or is this the beginning of the end for QNTM? One thing's for sure - the shorts are having a field day, and the longs are getting anxious. 

One thing's certain, the sector's got some major issues to work through, and QNTM's right in the thick of it. The chip shortage's not going away anytime soon, and until it does, QNTM's stock price is going to be on a rollercoaster ride to nowhere. Buckle up, folks, it's going to be a bumpy ride.
